text.section: No person shall take, pursue, possess, transport, purchase or sell or attempt to do so, any migratory birds, except as authorized by the Migratory Bird Treaty Act (40 Stat. 755) as amended and regulations under it.

No person sixteen (16) years of age or older shall hunt any waterfowl unless, at the time, in addition to the appropriate state hunting license and Kentucky waterfowl stamp, he has on his person a valid migratory bird hunting stamp of current issue as required by the Migratory Bird Hunting Stamp Act (48 Stat. 451) as amended.

law.history: Amended 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 365, sec. 9, effective July 15, 1988. -- Amended 1968 Ky. Acts ch. 38, sec. 16. -- Amended 1964 Ky. Acts ch. 143, sec. 1. -- Amended 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 200, sec. 45. -- Amended 1948 Ky. Acts ch. 78, sec. 17. -- Amended 1946 Ky. Acts ch. 84, sec. 13. -- Amended 1944 Ky. Acts ch. 124, sec. 6. -- Amended 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 68, sec. 33. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 1954d-54.
